title: Polish Snufkin
body:
DeviantArt: https://www.deviantart.com/ajzan-hataru/art/Polish-Snufkin-790269834?ga_submit_new=10%3A1553015429


I’ve got inspired by @avril-circus and her cute pictures of Moomin characters in various fantastic outfits. 

I wanted to do something like that and decided to draw Snufkin in clothes inspired by national costumes of Poland.  There’s a lot of regional traditional outfits for every part of my country, so I picked some elements and mixed them with Snufkin’s classic green coat and hat.

summary: i’ve seen at least a handful of people express some disappointment at the recent moominvalley ep so i just wanna clear some...
body:
i’ve seen at least a handful of people express some disappointment at the recent moominvalley ep so i just wanna clear some stuff up.

we know from trailers, future episode titles, promo images, concept art, and other stuff that there will be more episodes based on moominsummer madness, including the parts where pappa writes a play and snufkin commits numerous crimes.

its a fun book, esp the subplot with snufkin and little my which absolutely warrants an episode of its own imo. trying to cram every part of a book into a few shorts episodes (like another show i wont mention) means some story lines and characters arent going to get the attention they deserve, and good content we want to see on screen will inevitably get scrapped.

basically, they are just setting the stage for future episodes with this one (pun definitely intended), so they can tell the story in their own way without having to rush anything.

summary: It’s funny. I’m quite enjoying the new Moomin series, even though it definitely lacks a lot of the aspects of the source...
body:
It’s funny. I’m quite enjoying the new Moomin series, even though it definitely lacks a lot of the aspects of the source material, or the 90′s anime. 

I think they’ve definitely compressed a lot of things (”We got a crowdfunded 13-episode run, and we’re not sure if it’s gonna be any more than that!”) but for newcomers to the series (like me), it’s been a very nice ride so far!

2D and 3D animation are very different beasts, and all I can think of when I see certain shortcomings in this animation is ‘yep, cost efficiency.’ (With that said, the budget is apparently 20 million euros? They probably spent most of their budget on voice actors, or there’s an aspect to this that I’m missing. An average animation ep can be 1.2 million or higher.) 

Simplifying and making things look good at the same time can be very difficult, especially with 3D. It’s not the same warmth or richness that a lot of 2D stuff can bring. With that said, they’ve worked really hard to keep the lighting and colour quite soft, and the writing and music has a good whimsy to it. They’ve been playing around a little with characterisation, too, in a way that I think’s pretty interesting.

While they probably didn’t have time to do Moominsummer Madness in all its entirety, I do hope we see Snufkin and Little My go against the Park Keeper at some point. If not, I’m happy to see where this all goes. (I don’t recall Snufkin privately taking the bark schooner in other renditions of the story). They seem to be doing their own thing to some degree, and I’d like to see what comes of it.

summary: I'm a bit disappointed with Mymbles kids in the new show. Lazy animation, I mean all boys are identical, as are all girls, even...
question: I'm a bit disappointed with Mymbles kids in the new show. Lazy animation, I mean all boys are identical, as are all girls, even though they likely have different fathers. And even if mymble genes are that strong, it doesn't explain why they are all dressed identically. Way lazier than in the 90's anime. Okay, I'm more than a bit disappointed.
answer: I totally agree tbh.. I’m not fond of the animation at all actually. I find it to be not as warm, if that makes sense -the colors and atmosphere seem bleak & dull to me. It doesn’t have the same GLOW like I’m used to. The character designs are really underwhelming. Not intricate at all. I haven’t watched an episode yet, but I’ve seen clips n whatnot. I’m gonna watch cus u know.. it’s moomin, but idk.. very cute and all.. lol I guess I’m just way too attached to the original that anything else would be a disappointment no matter what 🤷‍♀️

tags: repesin ties montako kertaa jakson aikana
title: Muumimuikkunen vol. 2
body:
vol.1
Pakko päivittää ton teatterijakson jälkeen:

5. Muumipeikko tuijottaa haaveilevasti Nuuskamuikkusta verannalta ja huokailee kuinka kaikki on täydellistä ja ihanaa. Pikku-Myyki heittää, että kohta Muumi alkaa laulaa jtn imelää…

6. Muumi yritti saada kaarnalaivan ennustamaan hyvien aikojen säilymisestä (hmmmm tuli mieleen päivänkakkaran lehtien nyppiminen (; ). Muumi kellahtaa onnellisesti huoaten nurmikkoon: “Ahhhh lämmin kesä ja Nuuskamuikkunen”

7. Tulvasta selvittyään, kun Muumi äkkää Muikkusen nojailemassa kiveen:
Muumipeikko: NUUSKAMUIKKUNEN!!!
Nuuskamuikkunen: Muumipeikko *nostaa hatunlieriä pilke silmäkulmassa*
Muumipeikko: *pasmat menee sekasin ja selvittelee kurkkuaan*
Muumipeikko: Hei, Nuuskamuikkunen *esittää coolia ja on muina miehinä*
Pikku-Myy: -.- *huokaa ja pyörittelee silmiään kärsien*

8. Muikkunen ja Muumi kattoo kuinka kaarnalaiva pyörii yhä “väärään” suuntaan eli siihen “muutoksia” osoittavaan ja Muikkunen kysyy katsekontaktia välttelevältä Muumilta, että voisiko se olla “merkki jostain” (teidtätte kyllä mistä)
